content:
advertisement

As the presidential campaign trail dominates headlines a new musical will be performed this weekend focusing on the problem of immigration  a hot topic for the presidential hopefuls PERIOD

The Penn State New Musical Festival in its second year is presenting Take Me America a brand new musical dealing with immigrants struggle to gain citizenship in the United States said Raymond Sage professor of theatre and artistic director for the festival PERIOD

 Sage said PERIOD 

Sage said he started the festival two years ago because there was a need for the promotion of new works at Penn State PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Susan Russell theater professor and director for Take Me America said the festival is exciting because the writers are in attendance for all the rehearsals and performances PERIOD

 Russell said PERIOD

The cast is made up of theater students here at Penn State and it gives them a great opportunity to see what they will be doing as young performers Sage said PERIOD

The concept of the New Musical Festival is for both professional writers and students to get a chance to work with each other Russell said PERIOD

She said the writers have the chance to see their work performed and work out the kinks in the process while students get the opportunity to work with professionals and learn what its like to go on an open reading casting PERIOD

Russell said the performance is in the style of a stage reading meaning that the actors are performing with scripts PERIOD This adds an extra challenge to keep it exciting she added PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

Russell said the stage reading means they will not perform with a set or costumes because it is focusing on the script itself PERIOD

 Russell said PERIOD

Russell said the audience can look forward to hearing true stories about immigrants coming to America PERIOD

 she said PERIOD
